channel.title: Vestibule :: Suggestions for "Cutting off the browser fat from your app"
channel.description: A list of all suggestions made for "Cutting off the browser fat from your app"

item.title: Suggestion from the proposer
item.description:
I know it may sound like normal/common stuff like Clemens said, and maybe it is, but I'm going came with a plan to make your apps faster, optimizing your front-end not just CSS and JS, I'm talking about cleaner views, cache, the turbolinks approach on rails 4, and if the time on my side maybe more.

This may not be the specific ruby talk, but you know I think every purist rubist needs to be aware and take care of the their front end apps.

A lot of us are already doing it, but I'm sure that there are many people out there ignoring this matter

item.title: Suggestion from Clemens Kofler (@clemens)
item.description: What aspects of your talk are Ruby-specific? What can we (roughly) expect that isn't already covered by tools like YSlow, PageSpeed etc. and their accompanying documentation, blog posts etc.?

item.title: Suggestion from John Pagonis (@)
item.description: It sounds useful, but is there anything Ruby specific in your talk?
